sentences.en: an insider’s view of the way that a Japanese company works
sentences.cn: 业内人士对日本公司运作方式的看法

sentences.en: Anyone invests had better follow the insider stock sales pretty closely.
sentences.cn: 所有投资者最好密切关注内部股票的销售情况.

sentences.en: Ascertaining insider trading legally and definitely is a precondition to this aim.
sentences.cn: 有效打击内幕交易的前提是,必须在法律上明确界定什么是内幕交易.

sentences.en: Because of my connection with the bank you could be accused of insider trading.
sentences.cn: 我在银行里做事,你可能因此被人指控盗窃内部经济情报.

sentences.en: For the latest Insider Moves trades, login to the premium service.
sentences.cn: 欲获得[内线动态]最新的交易建议, 请登录付费服务.

sentences.en: German banks have more insider knowledge than most.
sentences.cn: 德国银行与大多数银行相比知晓更多的内部消息。

sentences.en: Germany still has no insider-dealing offence in its statute books.
sentences.cn: 德国的法律条文中仍未设立内幕交易罪。

sentences.en: Insider account remaining sum will be returned with postal remittance form still.
sentences.cn: 会员账户余额将以邮政汇款形式返还.

sentences.en: INSIDER TIP: This style works best with a small face.
sentences.cn: 专业建议: 小脸的人剪这个发型更好看.

sentences.en: Insider trading raised the average price and price volatility.
sentences.cn: 内幕交易使股票的平均价格上升,但也增加了价格的波动性.

sentences.en: Nowadays insider control of stocked corporations has endangered normal function strictly.
sentences.cn: 摘要当前上市公司内部人控制问题已经严重危及到公司的正常运营.

sentences.en: One insider who has seen the report said it was pretty jaw-dropping stuff.
sentences.cn: 一位看过此报道的内部人士说这绝对是令人震惊的爆料。

sentences.en: The author discusses thetheoretic basis of Insider Trading in depth.
sentences.cn: 深入探讨了法律禁止内幕交易的法理基础.

sentences.en: The harm from insider trading is the interference with the disclosure of corporate information.
sentences.cn: 幕后交易所致的损害是对公司信息的披露之干扰.

sentences.en: This revealing the food industry insider's book will make you an eye - opener!
sentences.cn: 这本大爆食品工业内幕的书将会使你大开眼界!

sentences.en: What individual investors access to the so - called insider information?
sentences.cn: 散户凭什么获得 所谓 的内幕信息?

words.tran_cn: [劳经]内部的人，会员；熟悉内情者

trans.tran_en: someone who has a special knowledge of a particular organization because they are part of it
